Title: 1446/MR Appointment of Structural/Civil Engineer for building of a covered storage facility
Description:
1446/MR Tender Opportunity - Appointment of Structural/Civil Engineer

The University of Sheffield is looking for suitably qualified and competent persons to undertake this work

The project is for the building of a covered storage facility with crane capacity of 50 Tonne. This is the ideal solution although a lower rating of crane may be acceptable if 50 Tonne is not possible due to site conditions and ground bearing capacities.
 
The objective is to provide a facility on a location on the Nuclear AMRC site that can store tests piece, materials and equipment to a weight of 50 Tonne. A feasibility study is required to determine the optimum location considering logistics of handling large items and budget constraints.  There are two site locations which would be suitable but each with different ground bearing capacities and access issues.

Title: Framework Agreement for Consultancy Services
Description:
Reallies is a social housing regeneration consortia. Its membership consists of regional housing consortia who bring together unmatched experience in procurement and regeneration. The membership consists of Procure Plus (PP), Efficiency North (EN) and Central Housing Investment Consortium (CHIC). Further information can be found by visiting www.reallies.com

Reallies wishes to procure and enter into a framework agreement for the provision of consultancy services to be completed predominantly in social housing properties but may also be carried out in other public buildings, including but not limited to, schools and offices.
Region: North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Wales
Additional Text:
Individual contracting authorities entitled to access the framework agreement will have the option to agree and award underlying contracts to the appointed suppliers at any stage during the term of the framework agreement. The following contracting authorities will be entitled to agree and award underlying contracts under the framework agreement as and when required:

1) any member of Reallies from time to time (a "Reallies Member"), which for the avoidance of doubt currently includes PP, EN and CHIC,

2) any procurement consortia customer of Reallies or of a Reallies Member from time to time (a "Procurement Consortium Customer" which currently includes Cumbria Housing Partnership Limited (CHP), and

3) any member or customer of a Reallies Member or of a procurement consortia customer from time to time, which may include:

i- any social housing provider in the United Kingdom from time to time. "Social Housing Provider" for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, registered providers, local authorities and Arms Length Management Organisations (ALMOs). A list of the current social housing providers can be found by visiting https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/current-registered-providers-of-social-housing and,

ii- any local authority, academy trust or free school in the United Kingdom from time to time,

4) any contractor or supplier appointed to any other framework agreement or contract of Reallies or of a Reallies member or of a Reallies member's customer from time to time.

A full list of PP's, EN's, CHP's and CHIC's current members and customers is included in the procurement documentation.

Reallies reserves the right to cancel the procurement at any time and not to proceed with all or any part of the framework. Reallies will not, under any circumstances, reimburse any expense incurred by bidders in preparing their submissions for the framework agreement.

Bidders should note that the Lot values in this notice are estimates only, and may increase depending on the number of entities that decide to award underlying contracts under the framework agreement.

Title: Victory Housing Trust, Consultants Framework
Description:
Victory Housing Trust is a registered charity and registered provider of affordable homes for those in housing need.  Victory owns nearly 5,000 properties and defines it's operational area as across the whole of Norfolk. Whilst the majority of the properties are located within the local authority area of North Norfolk, properties are also owned in the local authority areas of Broadland, King's Lynn & West Norfolk, Great Yarmouth, Norwich City, Breckland and South Norfolk.
The Trust employs nearly 90 staff at its head office in North Walsham and has an annual turnover of GBP 22 million. It invests approximately GBP10 million each year in planned improvement and repair works to its existing stock and has built over 577 new homes since it was formed in 2006 (by March 2015). It has a target to develop a further 740 homes by 2023.The  Corproate Plan (see website for more information www.victoryhousing.co.uk) sets out Victory's Vision, Mission and  three objectives which summarise our overall direction and purpose.
The  works value related to the construction costs that are predicted (and not guaranteed) at GBP 20m  to GBP 50 million  over a four year period for new build projects. Further, input to major refurbishment, repairs and adaptation projects also requiring professional services included in the frameworks currently range in value from 10,000 to 500,000 GBP .
